alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 01 at 3:10PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN QUAY AND WEST CENTRAL CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM MDT... At 310 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of House, or 31 miles northeast of Fort Sumner, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Quay, Ragland, and Mcalister. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
